title: HAL Link
description:
> A Link Object represents a hyperlink from the containing resource to a URI.

-- from [JSON Hypertext Application Language, section 5](https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-kelly-json-hal-08#section-5)

templated.description: > Its value is boolean and SHOULD be true when the Link Object's `href` property is a URI Template.\n\nIts value SHOULD be considered false if it is undefined or any other value than `true`.

href.description: > If the value is a URI Template then the Link Object SHOULD have a `templated` attribute whose value is `true`

type.description: > Its value is a string used as a hint to indicate the media type expected when dereferencing the target resource.

deprecation.description: > Its presence indicates that the link is to be deprecated (i.e. removed) at a future date.  Its value is a URL that SHOULD provide further information about the deprecation.

name.description: > Its value MAY be used as a secondary key for selecting Link Objects which share the same relation type.

profile.description: > Its value is a string which is a URI that hints about the profile (as defined by [I-D.wilde-profile-link](https://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-wilde-profile-link-04) of the target resource.

title.description: > Its value is a string and is intended for labelling the link with a human-readable identifier (as defined by [RFC5988](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5988))

hreflang.description: > Its value is a string and is intended for indicating the language of the target resource (as defined by [RFC5988](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5988)

href.description: > If the value is a URI Template then the Link Object SHOULD have a `templated` attribute whose value is `true`
